sections: Ronald McDonald House Charities is raffling off two extraordinary roadsters and when you use the
When it comes to collectible Corvettes, it really doesn’t get any better than this example. This stunning

features its original numbers matching 390-horsepower 427-cid V8 engine paired to its numbers matching Muncie 4-speed manual transmission and its date correct 3.55 positraction rear end. Corroborating the cars pedigree is its original tank sticker and options include a matching auxiliary hardtop, a side mount chambered exhaust, power steering, power 4-wheel disc brakes, and power windows. While this Corvette would make an excellent centerpiece to nearly any collection, some enthusiasts might prefer the styling of the roadster that inspired
its power game for the mid-year Corvette instead.

takes the styling of the 1960s roadster and refines it with decades of race proven, high performance technology. Down to the Guardsman Blue finish, Wimbledon White stripe, and stainless steel side exhaust pipes, visually this roadster is all ‘60s. But underneath a modern independent suspension provides the ultimate in driveability and handling while a Roush 427SRX V8 engine paired with a Tremec TKO 5-speed manual transmission offers a modern feeling 480-horsepower.
Regardless of which one of these

you would prefer to add to your garage, ​winning is simple. All you need to do to be entered into the drawing is make a charitable donation to Ronald McDonald House of the Central Valley here. Donations of $5.00 to $500.00 will be accepted and proceeds will go to benefit a really good cause that helps the families of sick children stay close by to the treatment facilities that they depend on.
, donate today, and help a child in need. Don’t forget to enter the
at check out to double your entries.
